description: The trap is send by agent when:
- One or more sensors entered abnormal temperature range (alarm raise)
- All the sensors returned to normal temperature (alarm cleared).
The reason of the trap is defined in its status object. The details of which sensor shows abnormal temperature
are reported in asMaxCmTemperatureMonitorTable. The summary of reason can be reported
in the trap StatusInfo object.
Normally only one trap is sent when the first sensor goes out of the normal temperature range.
Subsequent changes in the number of sensors showing abnormal temperature do not required
another trap, however the corresponding object in the asMaxCmTrapStatusTable should be updated on every change.
Default severity: Major
Reports current temperature alarm trap status as defined in the value list.
The status reports overall temperature condition of the system based on the reading
from multiple sensors. The status values have the following meaning:
- normalTemperature: all the sensors in the system show the temparature with normal range
- lowTempReached: one or more sensors show temperature below the lower limit
- highTempReached: one or more sensors show the temperature above the higher limit
- abnormalTemperature: one or more sensors show the temperature outside the normal range (too low or too high)
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmTemperatureStatus

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised. e.g.
- Hot/cold sensors=SDR,SCRT0,SCRT1
- All sensors OK
More details about the temperature sensors and their readings are reported
in table asMaxCmTemperatureMonitorTable.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmTemperatureStatusInfo

description: The trap is sent when the agent system controller identifies the condition critical to the system
operation e.g. overheating, and the imminent system shutdown is scheduled.
The exact reason of the shutdown is defined in ReasonCode object and additional details are given
in ReasonInfo trap object.
This trap is not sent when the condition clears. Instead expect one of the start related traps (coldstart/warmstart).
Default severity: Critical

Summary.eval: ($v2 ne '') ? '$v2' : 'System shutdown is scheduled due to $v1'

description: Reports the reason the board (box) executed shut down as defined in the value list.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxShutdownReasonCode

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised. e.g.
- Manual reset requested from console
- System overheated
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxShutdownReasonInfo

description: The trap is send by agent when:
- One or more sensors entered abnormal DC voltage range (alarm raise)
- All the sensors returned to nominal DC voltage range (alarm cleared)
The reason of the trap is defined in its status object. The details of which sensor shows abnormal DC voltage
are reported in asMaxCmDcVoltageMonitorTable. The summary of reason can be reported
in the trap StatusInfo object.
Normally only one trap is sent when the first sensor goes out of the normal DC voltage range.
Subsequent changes in the number of sensors showing DC voltage out of range do not required
another trap, however the corresponding object in the asMaxCmTrapStatusTable should be updated on every change.
Default severity: Major
Reports current DC voltage alarm trap status as defined in the value list.
The status reports overall DC voltage condition of the system based on the reading
from multiple sensors. The status values have the following meaning:
- dcVoltageNominal: all the sensors in the system show the DC voltage values within acceptable range
- dcVoltageOutOfRange: one or more sensors show the DC voltage outside the nominal range
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmDcVoltageStatus

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised. e.g.
- DC voltage out of range: DPRF-1, PSU-3
- All sensors OK.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmDcVoltageStatusInfo

description: Description.

Summary.eval: ($v1 == 0) ? 'PLL status is locked' : 'PLL status is unlocked'

description: Description.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmSdrMainPllStatus

description: The trap is send by agent when:
- One or more sensors entered abnormal power range [alarm raise)
- All the sensors returned to normal power (alarm cleared).
The reason of the trap is defined in its status object. The details of which sensor shows abnormal power
are reported in asMaxCmPowerMonTable. The summary of reason can be reported in the trap StatusInfo object.
Normally only one trap is sent when the first sensor goes out of the normal power range.
Subsequent changes in the number of sensors showing abnormal power do not require another trap.
However the corresponding object in the asMaxCmTrapStatusTable should be updated on every change.
Default severity: Major
Reports present power trap status as defined in the value list.
The status reports overall power condition of the system based on the reading from multiple sensors.
The status values have the following meaning:
- powerNormal: all the sensors in the system show the power values within acceptable range
- powerAbnormal: one or more sensors show the power outside the nominal range
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmPowerStatus

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised. e.g.
- DC voltage out of range: DPRF-1, PSU-3
- All sensors OK.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmPowerStatusInfo

description: The trap is send by agent when:
- One or more sensors entered abnormal current range [alarm raise)
- All the sensors returned to normal current (alarm cleared).
The reason of the trap is defined in its status object. The details of which sensor shows abnormal current
are reported in asMaxCmCurrentMonTable. The summary of reason can be reported in the trap StatusInfo object.
Normally only one trap is sent when the first sensor goes out of the normal current range.
Subsequent changes in the number of sensors showing abnormal current do not require another trap.
However the corresponding object in the asMaxCmTrapStatusTable should be updated on every change.
Default severity: Major
Reports present power trap status as defined in the value list.
The status reports overall power condition of the system based on the reading from multiple sensors.
The status values have the following meaning:
- powerNormal: all the sensors in the system show the power values within acceptable range
- powerAbnormal: one or more sensors show the power outside the nominal range
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmCurrentStatus

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised. e.g.
- DC voltage out of range: DPRF-1, PSU-3
- All sensors OK.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-ASMAX-COMMON-MIB::asMaxCmCurrentStatusInfo
